Package com.uddernetworks.emojide.gui.text

Class DefaultTextBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uddernetworks.emojide.gui.text.DefaultTextBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextBlock
    public class DefaultTextBlock
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextBlock
    A TextBlock that only tracks text in a fixed area, truncating any data outside of the given width and height.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DefaultTextBlock​(int width, int height)
      Creates a DefaultTextBlock with a fixed with and height, in emojis.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAll​(int y, char[] line)
      Adds the given char[] to the end of the content of a line.
      void addChar​(char character, int x, int y)
      Inserts the given character at the given coordinates.
      void addEmpty​(int y)
      Adds an empty character line at the given Y position, moving all other lines downward, truncating the last line.
      char getCharacter​(int x, int y)
      Gets the character at the given coordinates.

      Gets the characters of the TextBlock.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Gets the trimmed text.

      Adds a newline with respecting line breaking, simulating the pressing "Enter" on a keyboard at given coordinates.
      void onChange​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> onChange)
      Adds a listener for when the current TextBlock's text content changes.
      void removeChar​(int x, int y)
      Removes the character at the given coordinate, shifting all proceeding characters in the line.

      Sets the given coordinates to the given character.
      void setText​(java.lang.String text)
      Replaces the current text entirely with the given text.

      Converts the current text to an Emoji grid, with the internal width and height.

    • Method Detail

      • getCharArray

        public char[][] getCharArray()
        Description copied from interface: TextBlock
        Gets the characters of the TextBlock. The 2D array is just an array of rows, meaning the first length is the height, and the inner length is the width.
        Specified by:
        getCharArray in interface TextBlock
        Returns:
        A 2D array of characters.

      • addChar

        public void addChar​(char character,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        Description copied from interface: TextBlock
        Inserts the given character at the given coordinates. This will offset any other characters in the line proceeding it, truncating any overflows.
        Specified by:
        addChar in interface TextBlock
        Parameters:
        character - The character to insert
        x - The X position of the grid
        y - The Y position of the grid

      • toEmoji

        public Emoji[][] toEmoji​(EmojiManager emojiManager,
                         Emoji[][] initial)
        Description copied from interface: TextBlock
        Converts the current text to an Emoji grid, with the internal width and height, overriding the initial parameter. The parameter is used so it won't need to make the array on its own.
        Specified by:
        toEmoji in interface TextBlock
        Parameters:
        emojiManager - The DefaultEmojiManager
        initial - The initially generated Emoji[][]
        Returns:
        The 2D array of emojis
